headline.main: World Trade Talks Advance Despite Farm-Price Dispute

docs.snippet: LEAD: As if the senses are not overwhelmed by the ordinary treasures of Italy -the silky wines, antiquity all about - now comes one of the premier athletic events on the planet. Brace yourself.  The World Cup of soccer is a quantum leap from Super...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: As if the senses are not overwhelmed by the ordinary treasures of Italy -the silky wines, antiquity all about - now comes one of the premier athletic events on the planet. Brace yourself. The World Cup of soccer is a quantum leap from Super Bowls, Final Fours and other American curios, like the oddly named annual denouement of baseball, the World Series.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: This team-by-team analysis was written by Michael Janofsky. Argentina CUP HISTORY: Twice champion, in 1978 and 1986, Argentina has participated in the final round 10 of 11 times. 1990: Qualified as the defending champion. COACH: Carlos Bilardo, since 1983. OUTLOOK: An old team, beset by injuries in training and the unavailability of many players for training because they were playing in European club leagues, Argentina is relying heavily on the most famous player in the tournament, Diego Maradona, for the same kind of magic that helped the team win the cup in

headline.main: From the Mighty to the Maybes, 24 Nations Gather

docs.snippet: LEAD: Challenging traditional ways by which the world has measured the growth of nations, a new report issued by the United Nations Development Program concludes that there is no automatic link between a country's per capita income and the well-being...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Challenging traditional ways by which the world has measured the growth of nations, a new report issued by the United Nations Development Program concludes that there is no automatic link between a country's per capita income and the well-being and progress of its people.

headline.main: Higher Incomes, U.N. Finds, Do Not Assure a Better Life

byline.original: By BARBARA CROSSETTE, Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: LEAD: The leading clairvoyants in Yaounde, the capital of Cameroon, were recently polled by a local newspaper to determine the fortune of the national team in the 1990 World Cup finals. None offered an opinion.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The office of the United States Trade Representative is housed in a 19th- century building that once served as Union Army headquarters. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant occupied the spare, high-ceilingedroom that now is the office of Carla A. Hills, the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The office of the United States Trade Representative is housed in a 19th- century building that once served as Union Army headquarters. Gen. Ulysses S. Grant occupied the spare, high-ceilingedroom that now is the office of Carla A. Hills, the nation's chief trade negotiator.
